EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:



The Triumph Foods facility, located in Stockyards Industrial Complex in Saint Joseph, Missouri, is a pork slaughter/processing plant which employs approximatley 2800 area employees. The facility operates two production shifts and a maintenance/cleaning crew on third shift.  The facility just completed a recent Combo Cooler and Export Cooler expansion that increase the plant square footage to 775,000 sqft on a 59 acre plot. The Plant is refrigerated with 220,000 pound anhydrous ammonia system.  This is operated 24/7 by experienced, licensed refrigeration management and operators. 



Over one half of the plant is protected by an automatic sprinkler system where flammables and combusible materials are either used or stored.  The balance of the facility is of concrete and metal construction. Triumph Foods' fire protection system includes pull stations, smoke & heat detection, and sprinkler flow alarms. All are monitored by a remote off site alarm company 24/7 as well as the on site security personnel. The Alarm System is tested annually and Fire Suppression System is tested semi-annually by outside companies.   



Emergency declaration is done via radio and/or telephone to designated Emergency Coordinators, who will then direct activation of the plant alarm system which utilizes a combinations strobes/ chimes/air horns to alert employees of the type of hazards. 



The plant has a Plant Emergency Response Team of made up of refrigeration and maintenance personnel as well as a designated HAZMAT Building for response to any chemical spills or releases beyond the normal scope of work.   Plant Emergency Response Team members are trained to a 24Hr HAZWOPER Technician level and some management members are trained to Incident Commander. The plant has a certified trainer for HAZMAT Technician.    



Triumph Foods does not have a Fire Brigade on site, but the Saint Joseph Fire Department's Station #2 is within one-half mile from the plant, and Station #1

is within three miles. 



The plant has a Waste Water Pre-Treatment Plant to treat the plant's process water to permit specifications prior to discharging to the St Joseph POTW. Storm water runoff is managed by the use of detention ponds on the site. There is a valve located at the outfall to isolate storm water discharge. 



All employees are trained per OSHA, EPA regulations and other mandated industrial standards, including Hazards Communications which instructs employees on the particular hazards and proper handling of the cleaning and sanitizing chemicals used in the plant.  Particular emphasis is placed on the reporting of spills and releases or any other unusual events.



Triumph Foods has written emergency action and response plans which identify potential emergencies and the steps to be taken to safetly remove all employees from harms way in the event incidents should arise.  A Health Services Department is staffed by nurses on both production shifts. On non-production shifts/days, maintenance supervisors/superintendents have been trained in Basic First Aid/CPR/AED.



The plants Emergency Action and Response Plans are shared with the Saint Joseph Fire Department, Northwest Missouri Region H Hazardous Materials Response Team, and the St. Joseph/ Buchanan Co. Local Emergency Planning Committee.  Triumph Foods will host any emergency response agency wishing to tour the facility.



The Director of Safety and Environmental Affairs attends LEPC meetings and at least annually meets with the LEPC Chairman/Region H Coordinator.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:



Triumph Foods has not had any significant ammonia related accidents in the last five years of operation.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



The plant continues to improve training as listed above, including trying to certify in house trainer. The Plant is holding a 10 OSHA class monthly to improve the front line managers knowledge of safety. The Director of Refrigeration is working with an outside
LMS group to enhance the Refrigeration/Maintenance technicians continual training.
